casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 401A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 18, 2019 Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Teresa L. Townsend, Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney Generals, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Attorney at Law, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Molly McIntosh Jagannathan, Attorneys at Law, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, for Sierra Club. Peter H. Ledford, Attorney at Law, Benjamin Smith, Regulatory Counsel, for N.C. Sustainable Energy Association. Gudrun Thompson, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Justice Center, et al. David L. Neal, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Justice Center, et al. David T. Drooz, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorneys, for N.C. Utilities Commission-Public Staff.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 14th of March 2019 by Attorney General:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 18th of March 2019."

Attorney General shall have up to and including the 26th day of April 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
